00067         // Returns true if the string str1 is equal to str2. case sensitive.
00068         __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API bool kvi_strEqualCS(const char *str1,const char *str2);
00069         // Returns true if the forst len characters of string str1 are equal to str2.
00070         // case sensitive.
00071         // Note that if str1 or str2 are shorter than len characters then are considered as NOT equal!

00073         // no such tricks in non-asm
00074         #define kvi_strEqualNoLocaleCI(str1,str2) kvi_strEqualCI(str1,str2)
00075         #define kvi_strEqualNoLocaleCIN(str1,str2,len) kvi_strEqualCIN(str1,str2,len)
00076         #define kvi_strLen(str) strlen(str)
00077 #endif

00080 // case insensitive.

00100 
00101 //=============================================================================
00102 //
00103 // A simple string class.<br>
00104 // -No data sharing.<br>
00105 // -Not UNICODE.<br>
00106 // -Has ALWAYS NON-NULL DATA.<br>
00107 // -(Maybe)Unsafe :)<br>
00108 // WARNING : Handle with care and use at own risk :)<br>
00109 //
00110 //=============================================================================
00111 
00112 class KVILIB_API KviStr : public KviHeapObject
00113 {
00114 public:
00115         // No particular reason for these two names...
00116         // It is just because I like it :)
00117 
00118         enum KviFormatConstructorTag { Format, Sprintf };
00119 
00120         //=============================================================================
00121         // Constructors
00122         //=============================================================================
00123 
00124         // Empty string == "", len = 0, 1 byte allocated
00125         KviStr();
00126 
00127         // Deep copy of the NULL TERMINATED string (NULL str SAFE)
00128         KviStr(const char *str);
00129 
00130         // Copy len characters from string str (NOT NULL str SAFE, str MUST be at least len chars long)
00131         KviStr(const char *str,int len);
00132 
00133         // bg and end are pointers to a SINGLE string.<br>
00134         // A string is extracted starting from bg and ending at end (not included).<br>
00135         KviStr(const char *bg,const char *end);
00136 
00137         // Format constructor.<br>
00138         // tag is....yes....a dummy number used to resolve ambiguities.<br>
00139         // It is SAFE: will fail only if we run out of memory,<br>
00140         // but can handle only %s %d %u and %c.
00141         KviStr(KviFormatConstructorTag tag,const char *fmt,...);
00142 
00143         // Carbon copy :)...fast
00144         KviStr(const KviStr &str);
00145 
00146         // Compat with QT...<br>
00147         // WARNING : With QT2.x it WILL loose UNICODE data.<br>
00148         // Safe even if the QString is null.
00149         KviStr(const QString &str);
00150 
00151         KviStr(const QByteArray &str);
00152 
00153         // Fill sonstructor.
00154         // Creates a string long fillLen characters filled with character c.<br>
00155         KviStr(char c,int fillLen = 1);
00156 
00157         KviStr(const kvi_wchar_t * unicode);
00158 
00159         KviStr(const kvi_wchar_t * unicode,int len);
00160 
00161         // just free(m_ptr)
00162         ~KviStr();
00163 public:
00164         //yes...public..but think it as private...:)
00165         char *m_ptr; // pointer to allocated buffer, do not change this!
00166         int   m_len; // string data length not including the terminator
00167 
00168 public:
00169         //=============================================================================
00170         // Basic const interface (read stuff)
00171         //=============================================================================
00172 
00173         // Internal data buffer
00174         char * ptr() const              { return m_ptr; };
00175         // Length: fast, cached
00176         int len() const                 { return m_len; };
00177 
00178         // I hate this operator...but sometimes it is really useful
00179         // especially in macros (kvi_options.cpp)
00180         operator const char * () const  { return m_ptr; };
00181 
00182         bool isEmpty() const            { return (m_len == 0); };
00183         bool hasData() const            { return (m_len != 0); };
00184 
00185         // this is better than string = "", it does not call strlen
00186         void clear();
00187 
00188         // forces the length of this string to be iLen (iLen does NOT include the trailing null : it is automatically added)
00189         void setLength(int iLen);
00190 
00191         // Returns true if there is something "readable" inside the string
00192         bool hasNonWhiteSpaceData() const;
00193 
00194         // Character at zero-based index : always safe!
00195         char & at(int idx) const        { return ((idx < m_len) ? m_ptr[idx] : m_ptr[m_len]);        };
00196 
00197         // character checks
00198         bool lastCharIs(char ch)  const { return (m_len > 0) ? (*(m_ptr + m_len - 1) == ch) : false; };
00199         bool firstCharIs(char ch) const { return (*m_ptr == ch);                                     };
00200 
00201         // upper and lower case copies
00202         KviStr upper() const;
00203         KviStr lower() const;
00204         KviStr upperISO88591() const;
00205         KviStr lowerISO88591() const;
00206 
00207         // left, right & co.
00208         // all parameters are safety-checked
00209         KviStr left(int maxLen) const;
00210         KviStr right(int maxLen) const ;
00211         KviStr middle(int idx,int maxLen) const;
00212 
00213         KviStr leftToFirst(char c,bool bIncluded = false) const;
00214         KviStr leftToLast(char c,bool bIncluded = false) const;
00215 //      KviStr leftToFirst(const char * str); const;
00216 
00217         //=============================================================================
00218         // Non-const interface (write stuff)
00219         //=============================================================================
00220 
00221         // Null terminator is NOT included in len
00222         KviStr & setLen(int len);
00223         // str must not be 0, but len can be anything (it is checked)
00224         KviStr & setStr(const char *str,int len = -1);
00225         // Like the special constructor that gets the same args.
00226         void extractFromString(const char *begin,const char *end);
00227 
00228 
00229         // Safe sprintf. This one will never write past the end of the string
00230         // It can handle only %s %d %u and %c format flags.
00231         KviStr & sprintf(const char *fmt,...);
00232         
00233         KviStr & vsprintf(const char *fmt,kvi_va_list list);
00234 
00235         // append functions
00236         void append(const KviStr &str);
00237         void append(const QString &str);
00238         void append(char c);
00239         void append(const char *str);                                     // str CAN be 0
00240         void append(const char *str,int len);                             // str CAN NOT be 0, and MUST be at least len chars long
00241         void append(KviFormatConstructorTag dummy,const char *fmt,...);
00242 
00243         // prepend stuff, same as above
00244         void prepend(const KviStr &str);
00245         void prepend(const char *str);                                    // str CAN be 0
00246         void prepend(const char *str,int len);                            // str CAN NOT be 0, and MUST be at least len chars long
00247 
00248         // if lastCharIs ch does nothing otherwise appends it
00249         void ensureLastCharIs(char ch)              { if(!lastCharIs(ch))append(ch);        };
00250 
00251         // Change THIS string to uppercase or lowercase
00252         void toUpperISO88591();
00253         void toUpper(); // this is LOCALE AWARE (in Turkish it maps i to Ý!)
00254         void toLowerISO88591();
00255         void toLower();
00256 
00257         // Assignment
00258         KviStr & operator=(const KviStr &str);       // deep copy
00259         KviStr & operator=(const char *str);         // str can be NULL here
00260         KviStr & operator=(char c);                  // 2 bytes allocated,m_len = 1
00261         KviStr & operator=(const QString &str);
00262         KviStr & operator=(const QByteArray &str);
00263 
00264         // Append operators
00265         KviStr & operator+=(const KviStr &str)      { append(str); return (*this);          };
00266         KviStr & operator+=(const char *str)        { append(str); return (*this);          };
00267         KviStr & operator+=(char c)                 { append(c);   return (*this);          };
00268         KviStr & operator+=(const QString &str)     { append(str); return (*this);          };
00269 
00270         // Comparison
00271         bool equalsCI(const KviStr &other) const { if(m_len != other.m_len)return false; return kvi_strEqualCI(m_ptr,other.m_ptr); };
00272         bool equalsCS(const KviStr &other) const { if(m_len != other.m_len)return false; return kvi_strEqualCS(m_ptr,other.m_ptr); };
00273         bool equalsCI(const char * other) const { return kvi_strEqualCI(m_ptr,other); };
00274         bool equalsCS(const char * other) const { return kvi_strEqualCS(m_ptr,other); };
00275         bool equalsCIN(const char * other,int len) const { return kvi_strEqualCIN(m_ptr,other,len); };
00276         bool equalsCSN(const char * other,int len) const { return kvi_strEqualCSN(m_ptr,other,len); };
00277 
00278         //=============================================================================
00279         // HEX and Base64 stuff
00280         //=============================================================================
00281 
00282         // HEX transforms functions
00283         void bufferToHex(const char *buffer,int len);
00284         // Allocates the needed buffer and returns the allocated length,
00285         // returns -1 in case of error (and allocates nothing)
00286         // The string MUST contain only hex digits, and the digits MUST be in couples. (len % 2) must equal 0!
00287         // So this will fail also if there are leading or trailing spaces!
00288         int hexToBuffer(char ** buffer,bool bNullToNewlines = false);
00289         // BASE64 stuff
00290         void bufferToBase64(const char * buffer,int len);
00291         // same as hexToBuffer but obviously transforms base64 notation to binary data (len % 4) must equal 0!
00292         int base64ToBuffer(char ** buffer,bool bNullToNewlines = false);
00293 
00294         // frees a buffer allocated by hexToBuffer or base64ToBuffer
00295         static void freeBuffer(char * buffer);
00296 
00297         //=============================================================================
00298         // Splitters
00299         //=============================================================================
00300 
00301         // cut
00302         KviStr & cutLeft(int len);             // kills the first len characters
00303         KviStr & cutRight(int len);            // kills the last len characters
00304         KviStr & cut(int idx,int len);
00305         KviStr & cutToFirst(char c,bool bIncluded = true); // cuts the left part of the string up to the first character c or does nothing if the char c is not in the string
00306         KviStr & cutToLast(char c,bool bIncluded = true);
00307         KviStr & cutFromFirst(char c,bool bIncluded = true);
00308         KviStr & cutFromLast(char c,bool bIncluded = true);
00309         KviStr & cutToFirst(const char *c,bool bIncluded = true); // cuts the left part of the string up to the first character c or does nothing if the char c is not in the string
00310         KviStr & cutToLast(const char *c,bool bIncluded = true);
00311         KviStr & cutFromFirst(const char *c,bool bIncluded = true);
00312         KviStr & cutFromLast(const char *c,bool bIncluded = true);
00313         // & paste
00314         KviStr & insert(int idx,const char *data);
00315         KviStr & insert(int idx,char c);
00316         //Replaces all occurences of char c with the string str
00317         KviStr & replaceAll(const char c,const char *str);
00318         //same as above but with a string
00319         KviStr & replaceAll(const char *toFind,const char *str,bool bCaseS = true);
00320 
00321         KviStr & transliterate(const char * szToFind,const char * szReplacement);
00322 
00323         // Strips whitespace characters from beginning of this string.
00324         KviStr & stripLeftWhiteSpace();
00325         KviStr & stripRightWhiteSpace();
00326         // Stips inital and final WHITESPACE characters (see man isspace),<br>
00327         // and returns a reference to this string.
00328         KviStr & trimmed();
00329 
00330         // Strips spaces and tabs only
00331         KviStr & stripSpace();
00332         // Strips all occurences of the character c from the beginning of the string.<br>
00333         // Note that c can not be '\0' :)
00334         KviStr & stripLeft(char c);

00342         // and returns true if there are more tokens to extract<br>
00343         // Does not strip initial separators!!<br>
00344         // str can NOT be this string.
00345         bool getToken(KviStr &str,char sep);

00350         // Returns false if there was no data to extract

00359         // if sep is not 0, it is inserted between the strings
00360         // if bLastSep is true and sep is non 0, then sep is also appended at the end
00361         // of the buffer (after the last string)
00362         void joinFromArray(KviStr ** strings,const char * sep = 0,bool bLastSep = false);

00473 
00474 // Cool string parsing function.
00475 // It will extract the first found token from the string aux_ptr, and return
00476 // a pointer to the beginning of the next token, or end of the string.
00477 // It skips the initial sep characters!
00478 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API const char * kvi_extractToken(KviStr &str,const char *aux_ptr,char sep =' ');
00479 // Does not skip the beginning separators!
00480 // Extracts data from the string up to the next separator character or the end of the string.
00481 // and returns a pointer to that separator (or string end).
00482 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API const char * kvi_extractUpTo(KviStr &str,const char *aux_ptr,char sep=' ');
00483 // Reduced vsnprintf...
00484 // Handles %s,%c,%d,%u  (%% are TWO percents here and not one.)
00485 // Returns -1 if the formatted string exceeded the buffer length.
00486 // Otherwise returns the length of the formatted buffer...(not including '\0')
00487 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API int kvi_vsnprintf(char *buffer,int len,const char *fmt,kvi_va_list list);
00488 // Reduced vsnprintf: special version for irc.
00489 // Handles %s,%c,%d,%u  (%% are TWO percents here and not one.)
00490 // Writes up to 510 characters and terminates the string with a CRLF
00491 // Sets bTruncated if the requested format string was too large to fit in 512 bytes
00492 // otherwise sets it to false; The buffer MUST be at least 512 bytes long.
00493 // Always returns the length of the formatted buffer...(max 512 - min 2=CRLF)
00494 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API int kvi_irc_vsnprintf(char *buffer,const char *fmt,kvi_va_list list,bool *bTruncated);

00496 // WILDCARD EXPRESSION MATCHING FUNCTIONS
00497 
00498 // Returns true if the two regular expressions with wildcards matches
00499 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API bool kvi_matchWildExpr(register const char *m1,register const char *m2);
00500 // Returns true if the two regular expressions with wildcards matches, case sensitive
00501 //__KVI_EXTERN bool kvi_matchWildExprCS(register const char *m1,register const char *m2); // actually unused
00502 // Same as kvi_matchWildExpr but with an additional char that acts as string terminator
00503 // If there is a match this function returns true and puts the pointers where it stopped in r1 and r2
00504 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API bool kvi_matchWildExprWithTerminator(register const char *m1,register const char *m2,char terminator,
00505                         const char ** r1,const char ** r2);
00506 
00507 // Returns true if the wildcard expression exp matches the string str
00508 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API bool kvi_matchStringCI(register const char * exp,register const char * str);
00509 #define kvi_matchString kvi_matchStringCI
00510 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API bool kvi_matchStringCS(register const char * exp,register const char * str);
00511 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API bool kvi_matchStringWithTerminator(register const char * exp,register const char * str,char terminator,const char ** r1,const char ** r2);
00512 
00513 // This function works like a particular case of strncmp.
00514 // It evaluates if str2 is the terminal part of str1.
00515 // example: if str1 is "this is an experiment" and str2 is "xperiment"
00516 // return 0.
00517 // With the index parameter, the match start on str1 from the specified
00518 // index. For example:
00519 // if str1 is "this is an experiment" and str2 is "an" we have return !0
00520 // but "this is an experiment"
00521 //      012345678901234567890
00522 // if we call kvi_strsubRevCS("this is an experiment","an", 9) we got a match.
00523 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API int kvi_strMatchRevCS(const char *str1, const char *str2, int index=-1);
00524 
00525 // KviStr comparison non-member operators
00526 __KVI_EXTERN inline bool operator==(const KviStr &left,const KviStr &right)
00527 { return (left.m_len == right.m_len) ? kvi_strEqualCS(left.m_ptr,right.m_ptr) : false; }
00528 __KVI_EXTERN inline bool operator==(const KviStr &left,const char *right)
00529 { return kvi_strEqualCS(left.m_ptr,right); }
00530 __KVI_EXTERN inline bool operator==(const char *left,const KviStr &right)
00531 { return kvi_strEqualCS(left,right.m_ptr); }
00532 __KVI_EXTERN inline bool operator!=(const KviStr &left,const KviStr &right)
00533 { return !kvi_strEqualCS(left.m_ptr,right.m_ptr); }
00534 __KVI_EXTERN inline bool operator!=(const KviStr &left,const char *right)
00535 { return !kvi_strEqualCS(left.m_ptr,right); }
00536 __KVI_EXTERN inline bool operator!=(const char *left,const KviStr &right)
00537 { return !kvi_strEqualCS(left,right.m_ptr); }
00538 
00539 __KVI_EXTERN inline KviStr operator+(const KviStr &left,const KviStr &right)
00540 { KviStr ret(left); ret += right; return ret; }
00541 __KVI_EXTERN inline KviStr operator+(const KviStr &left,const char *right)
00542 { KviStr ret(left); ret += right; return ret; }
00543 __KVI_EXTERN inline KviStr operator+(const char *left,const KviStr &right)
00544 { KviStr ret(left); ret += right; return ret; }
00545 __KVI_EXTERN inline KviStr operator+(const KviStr &left,char right)
00546 { KviStr ret(left); ret += right; return ret; }
00547 __KVI_EXTERN inline KviStr operator+(char left,const KviStr &right)
00548 { KviStr ret(left); ret += right; return ret; }
00549 
00550 inline int kvi_compare(const KviStr * p1,const KviStr * p2)
00551 {
00552         return kvi_strcmpCI(p1->ptr(),p2->ptr());
00553 }
